content.question:
The line begins at the origin.

As x increases, the line slants gradually up.

The curve has approximately the shape of a parabola that opens upward.

The curve begins at the origin.

As x increases, the curve trends up gradually then sharply.

The curve has approximately the shape of a parabola that opens to the right.

The curve begins at the origin.

As x increases, the curve trends up sharply then gradually.

The curve has approximately the shape of an S.

The curve begins at the origin.

As x increases, the curve trends up gradually, then sharply, then gradually.

The figure shows a container in the shape of a circular cone. The container is being filled with water at a constant rate until the container is completely full. Which of the following could be the graph that models the dependent variable of depth of the water, in centimeters, as a function of the independent variable of time, in hours?

choices.label: Graph of a line in the x y plane with the origin labeled O. The x axis is labeled Time, in hours. No range is indicated. The y axis is labeled Depth, in centimeters. No range is indicated. Refer to long description.

Graph of a curve in the x y plane with the origin labeled O. The x axis is labeled Time, in hours. No range is indicated. The y axis is labeled Depth, in centimeters. No range is indicated. Refer to long description.

Graph of a curve of the x y plane with the origin labeled O. The x axis is labeled Time, in hours. No range is indicated. The y axis is labeled Depth, in centimeters. No range is indicated. Refer to long description.

Graph of a curve in the x y plane with the origin labeled O. The x axis is labeled Time, in hours. No range is indicated. The y axis is labeled Depth, in centimeters. No range is indicated. Refer to long description.

content.answer: Graph of a curve of the x y plane with the origin labeled O. The x axis is labeled Time, in hours. No range is indicated. The y axis is labeled Depth, in centimeters. No range is indicated. Refer to long description.

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
